thread.section_title: Real Estate News - Luxury Homes, Property Market and Mortgage Rates - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Luxury Homes That Invite Outdoor Living

author: Sandra Ward
title: Luxury Homes That Invite Outdoor Living
text:
0 COMMENTS $16.850 million Phoenix
Six bedrooms, seven bathrooms, two half-baths
The 12,000-square-foot main house on 5 acres has five patios overlooking a pool and fountains. A family room by the kitchen and breakfast room connects to a covered patio running the length of the home. An office and gym are in separate buildings.
Agent: Libby Cohen, Walt Danley Christie’s International
Photo: Andy Warren (2) $2.599 million Winston-Salem, N.C.
Five bedrooms, six bathrooms, one half-bath
This 8,076-square-foot French Provincial-style house in the Stone Oaks community has several covered patios, plus one surrounding an in-ground pool. A basement rec room opens onto its own patio. The kitchen, dining and living rooms also look onto a patio.
Agent: Dee Priddy, Coldwell Banker
Photo: Vala/MW Studio (2) $3.825 million Manhattan
Two bedrooms, two baths, one half-bath
This 1,600-square-foot postwar triplex penthouse has a private roof deck with 1,000 feet of outdoor space and an adjacent glass sunroom. The living and dining areas on the first level, and the master bedroom on the second, have access to balconies.
Agent: Gail Bomze, Compass
